intro: Calochortus superbus var. pratensis, commonly known as the showy globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and are typically borne on tall, slender stems. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine, hairy coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky slopes. Calochortus superbus var. pratensis is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
